cyclone.name: GRACE
cyclone.current_location: about 355 mi (570 km) ESE of the Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Moving quickly west across the northern Leeward Islands tonight, then west-northwest across the U.S./British Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico on Sunday before reaching Hispaniola Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Leeward Islands (initial landfall), closest passage across the Virgin Islands

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at present (watches likely later for Hispaniola/Greater Antilles)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Antigua and Barbuda, Anguilla, St. Kitts and Nevis, Montserrat, Saba, Sint Eustatius, Sint Maarten, St. Martin, St. Barthelemy, British Virgin Islands, U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico including Vieques and Culebra
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands through the U.S. and British Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–45 mph with higher gusts) expected Sunday, particularly midday through Sunday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated above minor coastal run-up
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain with potential flash and urban flooding and isolated mudslides
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along east- and south-facing shores
